waking-prayers.preface: These prayers are said at home before going to Shul.

shacharis.preface: Shacharis is the daily morning prayer service, ideally recited with a congregation. It is the longest of the daily prayers and includes the Shema and the Amidah.

mincha.preface: Mincha is the daily afternoon prayer, corresponding to the afternoon sacrifice in the Temple. Its earliest time begins a half-hour after halachic midday.

maariv.preface: Maariv is the daily evening prayer service, recited after nightfall. Halachically, the day ends and a new day begins at nightfall.
